metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1353 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in the pfkey_register function innet/key/af_key.c in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local,unprivileged user to gain access to kernel memory, leading to a systemcrash or a leak of internal kernel information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-189.200
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-189.200
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-189.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-189.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-189.200
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-189.200').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
